page.title: 15BAYDALE FARM IN DARLINGTON
page.content: There have been three principal houses called Baydale Farm, the first was in Blackwell, but that was demolished in 1900, the second, on the hill, is now privately owned and the third in its present position down by the River Tees.The farm has belonged to generations of the Brown family since about 1800.On the 163 acres of fertile soil that he owns, including Baydale Wood, he grows wheat, barley, potatoes and grass. The land has always had the same use and can be partly flooded at times. In 1965 three quarters of the land was flooded when a dam further up the River Tees was opened. Mr.Brown owns 80 cows, 2 cockerels,several hens and a goat. Fifteen of the cows are for breeding and the rest are for butchering. Mr. Brown has a caravan and he has a holiday in his least busy week.
